author: chris2_2_2
content: To comment on the meeting this morning, most of the public likely doesn't have the patience to join in multiple testnets. My suggestion would be to just have a big one before the merge. This will lead to the best test possible for the merge to ensure there are no bugs (most participants), will greatly increase confidence for the merge, and will also best help prepare people for the merge/advertise it. Also your going to have a lot of support requests on the R&D channel whenever there is a large public testnet so not having multiple will likely save some headache.

author: timbeiko
content: Hmm, the challenge is we have multiple testnets with usage *today*

author: timbeiko
content: So we need to do something about them, and I suspect most users would actually be more mad if we just shut them down. Also, each time we run one through the merge, we may learn something new/find a bug, so that's a valuable process.
